snippet: Just under 50 percent said they supported it, according to an opinion poll published in January.
abstract: King Juan Carlos's announcement that he is abdicating after nearly 40 years on the throne in favor of his son Felipe immediately raises question of whether Spain needs a monarchy at all; opinion polls published in January 2014 by conservative newspaper El Mundo show that just under 50 percent of Spaniards support the monarchy; thousands are demanding a referendum on whether to maintain the institution.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Just under 50 percent said they supported it, according to an opinion poll published in January.

headline.main: New King or, Spaniards Ask, Is It Time for No King?
headline.print_headline: New King or, Spaniards Ask, Is It Time for No King?

keywords.value: Juan Carlos I, King of Spain
keywords.name: persons
